title: What channel is Brazil vs Senegal? TV information and live stream details
text:

Brazil will be taking on Senegal for the first time on Thursday afternoon as the South American champions meet the World Cup fan favourites.

This will be the first match for Senegal since their 1-0 loss against Algeria in the African Cup final where they had an impressive run and the team have won eight of their last ten matches.

They also made a big impact in the 2018 World Cup with their team spirit and strong attack which was evident when they beat Lewadowski’s Poland 2-1.

They were were the first team in World Cup history to be eliminated by the fair play criteria after accumulating more bookings than Japan, who had the same amount of points in their group.

Brazil failed to build on their summer Copa America in two disappointing matches recently when they drew 2-2 against Colombia and were defeated 1-0 by Peru, ending their 17 match unbeaten run.

(Image: REUTERS)

Their clash with Senegal has generated controversy due it being staged in Singapore, with Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp having expressed concern that Sadio Mane and Robert Firminho have had to travel to take part in the fixture before their upcoming Premier League clash against Manchester United .

Here is all the key information ahead of the match...

When is the match?

La Seleção will meet Senegal for the first time on Thursday October 10th, 2019 at 13:00 BST.

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)

Where is the match being played?

The match is taking place at the National Stadium in Singapore, where the Brazil team arrived on Monday. Sadio Mane and the rest of The Lions of Teranga arrived on Tuesday as Mane was serenaded by the crowd.

What TV channel is it on and can it be live streamed?

The match will be televised live on LFCTV as two of Liverpools star players face off. It can also be streamed live on LFCTV GO and fans can sign up for a one month free trial the app.

(Image: REUTERS)

Team news

Brazil are in Singapore for back-to-back international fixtures and after taking on Senegal they will face off against Nigeria on Monday. Brazil has taken a strong team to Singapore with PSG stars Neymar, Marquinhos and Thiago Silva, Liverpool's Robert Firminho and Bayern Munich's Philippe Coutinho, with Dani Alves as captain.

Senegal, who finished second in the African Cup of Nations, will start the AFCON 2021 qualifying campaign next month so this will be a strong test for them.

Coach Aliou Cisse is looking to youth for this match and has selected players with minimum international experience, but has still included his biggest stars including Liverpool’s Sadio Mane, Napoli’s Kalidou Koulibaly and PSG’s Idrissa Gueye.
description: Liverpool stars Sadio Mane and Roberto Firmino to play in controversial Singapore friendly along with likes of Neymar, Philippe Coutinho and Kalidou Koulibaly
